test-case.name: fn-nilled-1
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with argument set to empty sequence. Use fn:count to avoid empty file

test-case.name: fn-nilled-2
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with argument set to comment node. Use fn:count to avoid empty file

test-case.name: fn-nilled-3
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with argument set to an element node.

test-case.name: fn-nilled-4
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with argument set to an element node.

test-case.name: fn-nilled-5
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with argument set to an element node with xsi:nill = true.

test-case.name: fn-nilled-6
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with argument set to an element node with xsi:nill = false.

test-case.name: fn-nilled-7
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with argument set to an element node with xsi:nill = fn:true().

test-case.name: fn-nilled-8
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with argument set to an element node with xsi:nill = fn:false().

test-case.name: fn-nilled-9
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with more than one argument.

test-case.name: fn-nilled-10
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function as argument to fn:not function. returns true.

test-case.name: fn-nilled-11
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function as argument to fn:not function. returns false.

test-case.name: fn-nilled-12
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function used a part of boolean expression ("and" operator and fn:true()

test-case.name: fn-nilled-13
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function used a part of boolean expression ("and" operator and fn:false()

test-case.name: fn-nilled-14
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function used a part of boolean expression ("or" operator and fn:true()

test-case.name: fn-nilled-15
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function used a part of boolean expression ("or" operator and fn:false()

test-case.name: fn-nilled-16
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function used as argument to fn:string function.

test-case.name: fn-nilled-17
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function used as argument to xs:boolean function. Returns false

test-case.name: fn-nilled-18
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function used as argument to xs:boolean function. Returns false

test-case.name: fn-nilled-19
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with argument set to a document node

test-case.name: fn-nilled-20
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with argument set to an attribute node

test-case.name: fn-nilled-21
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with argument set to a comment node
test-case.test: fn:nilled(<!-- This is a comment node -->)

test-case.name: fn-nilled-22
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with argument set to a processing instruction node

test-case.name: fn-nilled-23
test-case.description: nilled() applied to document node (Allowed in 3.0).

test-case.name: fn-nilled-24
test-case.description: nilled() applied to element node (Allowed in 3.0).

test-case.name: fn-nilled-25
test-case.description: nilled() applied to attribute node (Allowed in 3.0).

test-case.name: fn-nilled-26
test-case.description: nilled() applied to text node (Allowed in 3.0).

test-case.name: fn-nilled-27
test-case.description: nilled() applied to untyped element node with xsi:nil=true (Allowed in 3.0).

test-case.description: nilled() : context item is atomic

test-case.description: nilled() : context item is a function item

test-case.description: nilled() : context item is absent

test-case.description: nilled() : with nillable content (!)

test-case.name: fn-nilled-38
test-case.description: If node is nilled, its typed value is empty

test-case.name: fn-nilled-39
test-case.description: If node is nilled, its typed value is empty

test-case.name: fn-nilled-40
test-case.description: If node is nilled, it matches element(E, T?)
test-case.test: import schema namespace ids="http://www.w3.org/XQueryTest/nillable"; /ids:root/ids:branch/ids:branch[1] instance of element(ids:branch, ids:root?)

test-case.name: fn-nilled-41
test-case.description: If node is nilled, it doesn't match element(E, T)
test-case.test: import schema namespace ids="http://www.w3.org/XQueryTest/nillable"; /ids:root/ids:branch/ids:branch[1] instance of element(ids:branch, ids:root)

test-case.name: fn-nilled-42
test-case.description: If node is nilled, it matches element(E, T?)

test-case.name: fn-nilled-43
test-case.description: If node is nilled, it matches element(E, T?)

test-case.name: fn-nilled-44
test-case.description: If node is nilled, it does not match element(E, T)

test-case.name: fn-nilled-45
test-case.description: If node is nilled, it does not match element(E, T)

test-case.name: fn-nilled-46
test-case.description: Nilled value with user-defined simple type

test-case.name: fn-nilled-47
test-case.description: If node is nilled, its typed value is empty (user-defined simple type)

test-case.name: fn-nilled-48
test-case.description: If node is nilled, it does not match element(E, T)
test-case.test: import schema namespace ids="http://www.w3.org/XQueryTest/nillable"; /ids:root/ids:branch/ids:date instance of element(*, ids:date)

test-case.name: fn-nilled-49
test-case.description: If node is nilled, it matches element(E, T?)
test-case.test: import schema default element namespace "http://www.w3.org/XQueryTest/nillable"; /root/branch/date instance of element(*, date?)

test-case.name: fn-nilled-50
test-case.description: Nilled value with user-defined complex type with simple content

test-case.name: fn-nilled-51
test-case.description: If node is nilled, its typed value is empty (user-defined complex type with simple content)

test-case.name: fn-nilled-52
test-case.description: If node is nilled, it does not match element(E, T)
test-case.test: import schema namespace ids="http://www.w3.org/XQueryTest/nillable"; /ids:root/ids:branch/ids:size instance of element(*, ids:size)

test-case.name: fn-nilled-53
test-case.description: If node is nilled, it matches element(E, T?)
test-case.test: import schema namespace ids="http://www.w3.org/XQueryTest/nillable"; /ids:root/ids:branch/ids:size instance of element(*, ids:size?)

test-case.name: K-NilledFunc-1
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `nilled()`.

modified.change: Bug fix related to bug #14854: Added dependency

test-case.name: K-NilledFunc-2
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `nilled((), "wrong param")`.

test-case.name: K-NilledFunc-3
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `empty(nilled( () ))`.

test-case.name: K-NilledFunc-4
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `nilled(1)`.

test-case.name: cbcl-nilled-001
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with a non-nil nillable element

test-case.name: cbcl-nilled-002
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with a nil nillable element

test-case.name: cbcl-nilled-003
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with a non-nil nillable element

test-case.name: cbcl-nilled-004
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with a non-nil nillable element

test-case.name: cbcl-nilled-005
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with a nil nillable element
test-case.test: import schema namespace tc="http://www.w3.org/XQueryTest/testcases"; let $v := validate { <tc:nillable xsi:nil="true" /> } return fn:nilled($v)

test-case.name: cbcl-nilled-006
test-case.description: Evaluation of nilled function with a non-nil nillable element
test-case.test: import schema namespace tc="http://www.w3.org/XQueryTest/testcases"; let $v := validate { <tc:nillable /> } return fn:nilled($v)

test-case.name: cbcl-nilled-007
test-case.description: Test fn:nilled on non-element nodes.
